p: Data were transcribed within 24 hours of the interview and analyzed using Colaizzi's phenomenological method. Colaizzi's analysis is divided into seven stages ( Trice,Â 1990): (1) Reading all interview materials to form a general understanding of the research object; (2) Extracting statements related to the research problem; (3) Summarizing, extracting and encoding the extracted data; (4) Summarizing the encoded ideas and seeking common concepts to form themes and theme groups; (5) Performing a detailed description of the relationship between the theme and the research object; (6) Stating the essential structure that constitutes the phenomenon; (7) Returning the final analysis to the research object for verification. Two researchers independently coded, summarized, and refined the interview materials to form primary and secondary themes. Discrepancies were solved by discussions and coming to consensus with experienced peers within the research team. Patients were contacted if doubts arose during data confirmation.
